content: Who wrote the famous 1851 novel about a great white whale named Moby Dick?

The famous 1851 novel about a great white whale named Moby Dick was written by Herman Melville. The full title of the book is "Moby-Dick; or, The Whale." It's considered one of the greatest American novels and explores themes of obsession, morality, and the human condition through the story of Captain Ahab's quest to hunt down the elusive white whale.
